abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Road Maintenance and
            Rehabilitation Project aims at improving the effectiveness
            of Poland's national road rehabilitation, and
            maintenance systems, with emphasis on quality, efficiency,
            financial viability, and road user satisfaction. The project
            includes two components: 1) The General Directorate for
            National Roads and Motorways (GDDKiA) road maintenance and
            rehabilitation program; and, 2) implementation of GDDKiA
            management information system (MIS). The road maintenance
            and rehabilitation program has been prepared by GDDKiA
            within the framework of the 2005 budget. For the period
            beyond 2005 the proposed program is expected to be well
            balanced between maintenance-rehabilitation, strengthening
            and reconstruction of existing roads, together with new
            construction of motorways and expressways. Its financing
            will be from both, domestic and foreign sources. The second
            component - GDDKiA MIS - will support the implementation of
            a modem management and information system (MIS) within
            GDDKiA, that will properly integrate all data necessary to
            efficiently carry out its activities (including technical,
            financial, human resources, and contract related data) and
            support all core functions and decision-making processes
            within GDDKiA. This Component will include, but not be
            limited to: a) development of an Enterprise Resource
            Planning (ERP), consisting of integrated modules such as
            planning, controlling, finances, fixed assets management,
            human resources management, and project management; b)
            development of a system workflow for the management of
            documents and information; and, c) procurement of any
            related system, supporting equipment, and hardware/software.
